articles.title: A breakdown of the changes to the Nasdaq-100 and what it means for mega-cap tech stocks
articles.summary: Nasdaq announced a special rebalance of the Nasdaq-100 Index to dilute the weightings of mega-cap tech stocks that have outperformed in 2023. The seven largest stocks in the Nasdaq-100 will see their combined weighting reduced from 56% to 44%, with Nvidia and Microsoft being most affected. Historically, similar rebalances have not had a significant impact on stock prices.

articles.title: For Long-Term EM Growth, India Answers the Bell
articles.summary: India is positioned to become the world's second-largest economy by 2075 and is already among the top-performing emerging markets. The VanEck India Growth Leaders ETF (GLIN) offers investors exposure to Indian equities, utilizing a growth at a reasonable price (GARP) methodology. India's economic growth, a large and growing population, and government efforts to attract manufacturing contribute to its long-term investment appeal.

articles.title: RSPT: Right Idea for More Balanced Approach to Tech
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing concentration risk in the technology sector, highlighted by the outperformance of a few mega-cap stocks in the cap-weighted S&P 500 Information Technology Index. It presents the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Technology ETF (RSPT) as a solution for investors seeking a more diversified approach, noting its strong year-to-date performance despite its equal-weighting strategy. The article suggests that historical trends of tech concentration reversing could favor equal-weighted strategies like RSPT.

articles.title: SIT Investment Associates Inc Acquires Stake in Neuberger Berman High Yield Strategies Fund
articles.summary: SIT Investment Associates Inc acquired 2,043,847 shares of Neuberger Berman High Yield Strategies Fund on July 12, 2023. The transaction, valued at $7.59 per share, had a 0.42% impact on SIT's portfolio. Despite the target company's stock being deemed significantly overvalued with poor financial health indicators by GuruFocus, SIT's investment may represent a long-term strategic move.

articles.title: Apple opens store on China's WeChat platform
articles.summary: Apple has opened an official store on Tencent's WeChat platform in China, expanding its retail presence in the country's second-largest economy. This move allows WeChat users to purchase Apple products directly through the dominant messaging app, following a trend of Chinese consumers increasingly using social media for shopping. The expansion comes as Apple recorded a significant market share in China's smartphone market despite an overall decline in sales.

articles.title: If You Like JEPI, You’ll Love This ETF With an 11.9% Dividend Yield
articles.summary: This article introduces the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) as an alternative to the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI), highlighting its 11.9% dividend yield. JEPQ invests in Nasdaq 100 stocks, focusing on tech giants, and uses a covered-call strategy similar to JEPI to generate income. While offering a high yield and potential downside protection, JEPQ has lagged behind a comparable Nasdaq ETF (QQQ) in total return during a bull market.

articles.title: Apple loses London appeal in 4G patent dispute with Optis
articles.summary: London's Court of Appeal dismissed Apple's appeal in a patent dispute with Optis Cellular Technology LLC, ruling that Apple infringed two 4G telecommunications patents. Texas-based Optis sued Apple in 2019, alleging that the patents are essential to certain technological standards used in devices like iPhones and iPads. This ruling is the latest decision in a legal battle that has involved multiple trials and appeals in Britain.

articles.title: For Long-Term EM Growth, India Answers the Bell
articles.summary: India is projected to become the world's second-largest economy by 2075 and is already a leader in emerging markets. Investors can access this growth through ETFs like the VanEck India Growth Leaders ETF (GLIN), which focuses on companies with strong growth prospects and adheres to a growth-at-a-reasonable-price (GARP) methodology. India's economic growth, large democracy, and increasing role as a manufacturing hub—potentially surpassing China—further enhance its long-term appeal for investors.

articles.title: Apple executives fight subpoenas in shareholders' lawsuit against Qualcomm
articles.summary: Apple Inc.'s chief operating officer and a top corporate lawyer are attempting to quash subpoenas in a private securities class action lawsuit against chipmaker Qualcomm. They argue that their previous testimony and documents provided in an FTC antitrust case against Qualcomm make further questioning irrelevant to the current shareholder litigation. Apple contends that Qualcomm is using the subpoenas to harass the company.

articles.title: Kopin Corp is the Technology Seen Behind Smart AR Glasses
articles.summary: Kopin Corp (NASDAQ: KOPN), a high-resolution microdisplay maker, is highlighted as a key technology provider for smart AR glasses, including supplying displays for Vuzix and Alphabet. Despite an 80% drop from 2021 highs, the company has made significant advancements, such as achieving 3 million nits brightness for its 2K x 2K MicroLED displays, essential for AR in bright conditions. Kopin's Q1 2023 results showed increased product revenues, especially in defense, and the new CEO emphasized renewed focus on quality and efficiency to improve margins and achieve cash flow breakdown by year-end.
